primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God interrupts the 'vicious circle' of human impotence and death by taking the initiative to establish an eternal kingdom through Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord himself will build a house for you.
God has made a decision to be merciful.
His kingdom will have no end.
The message was said to be, not from man, but from God.

ontvanger.identificatie: Humanity (The ignorant, the dying, the impotent)
tekstueel_bewijs: God has moved, not we to him in our impotence, but he to us.
Rejoice! Emmanuel shall come to thee, O Israel!

helper.identificatie: The Angel Gabriel / Jesus Christ (as the 'House')
tekstueel_bewijs: The angel Gabriel has bisected the ghastly yellow clouds.
The promised Son of David... his arm is faithful.
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject and the source of the Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the power of the Virgin Birth.

tegenstander.identificatie: Death, Impotence, Sin, and the 'Vicious Circle' of History
tekstueel_bewijs: The precariousness of being alive and human.
The arm of flesh will fail you.
The hellish underside of some other realm.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not a moral lapse but the ontological reality of death and the failure of all human systems (statecraft, family, health).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: There is no secondary ethical program explicitly developed; the sermon remains focused on the primary soteriological event.
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher focuses entirely on the Annunciation as an act of God, leaving the 'response' as simply 'Rejoice'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord himself will build a house for you.
God stated that he was not in the least dependent on rickety human arrangements.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: David made plans to build a great temple.
We are invited to live with our deeper, less comfortable selves.

voorbeelden: We are invited to live with our deeper selves.
The kind of humiliating decline that we all pray to escape.
At three o’clock in the morning I know that I am ignorant.
The arm of flesh will fail you.
By the only power in heaven and earth that is able to do such a thing.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Pouvoir-faire' (Power) analysis. It diagnoses human 'Non-Pouvoir' (impotence) and proclaims God's 'Pouvoir' (sovereignty).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (David's death/Updike's dread) to ~S1 (David's failed plan) to S1 (The Annunciation).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God 'bisects' the square, moving from S1 directly into the realm of S2 to rescue the Receiver.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; death and dread are described with visceral realism.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is a textbook example of theocentric preaching. It explicitly rejects human agency as the source of salvation and places God as the sole Subject of the saving action.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: You aren’t going to build a house for me, I’m going to build a house for you.
I was fifty-five, ignorant, dying, and filling this bit of Finland with the smell of my stale sweat.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: David is introduced as a hero but immediately deconstructed into a pathetic, shivering, impotent man to prove that even the 'best' human is not the Subject of the story.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides the theocentric reading: David is the recipient of a promise he cannot fulfill.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'building the house' is removed.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The movement from David to Updike to the Hearer to Mary is perfectly integrated by the theme of 'impotence vs. divine initiative'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The vicious circle of our existence has been bisected by the Son of the Most High.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the implied agent of the 'Word made flesh'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is seen as the 'precariousness of being human' and the 'arm of flesh' failing.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject. It uses human 'Non-Pouvoir' as the foil for God's 'Pouvoir'.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is for an Advent sermon.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon is perfectly balanced for its purpose.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (death/impotence) is already highly intensified.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace'. The sermon refuses to give the hearer a 'to-do' list, offering instead a 'done' proclamation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the Updike anecdote; Greimas shows that Updike and David function as the same actant (the failing Subject).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Nathan's prophecy; semiotics shows how the prophecy functions to switch the Subject from David to God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Virgin Birth' is not just a biological claim but a semiotic necessity to show God as the sole Actor.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the '3:00 AM' motif to strip the hearer of all 'Pouvoir-faire', preparing them to be the 'Destinataire' (Receiver) of the 'Objet' (Grace).
